messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: SandraDodd website and Calif. R-4 affidavit
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/22/03 2:55:14 PM, evelynsfarm@msn.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/22/03 2:55:14 PM, evelynsfarm@... writes:

<< No I have not been to one of the
conferences in Sacramento. I am planning to go this year. Will you
be there? It would be fun to meet you! >>

I was there in 2001 and 2002, but for 2003 they have decided to change
formats to mostly-panel-discussions, and while they would have been willing
to have had me on panels, they're unwilling to pay for a room or
transportation this year.

I'm disappointed.

Holly is REALLY disappointed.

But maybe 2004.

Their website is here:

http://conference.hsc.org/

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: SandraDodd website and Calif. R-4 affidavit
messages.msgSnippet: I live in Grass Valley, Calif.  No I have not been to one of the conferences in Sacramento.  I am planning to go this year.  Will you be there? It would be fun
messages.messageBody:
I live in Grass Valley, Calif. No I have not been to one of the
conferences in Sacramento. I am planning to go this year. Will you
be there? It would be fun to meet you! I enjoyed seeing you and your
family on your site also. It is nice to put a human face on these
posts!!!

I tried yesterday to file my R-4 affidavit to set up my private
school (Calif. regulations) so I can leave our charter school but
found the Calif. Dept. of Ed.(CDE) has changed their policy and you
can no longer fill the form out online as of 1/06/03. You now have
to request the form in writing. I contacted HSC and their legal
committee told me NOT to call CDE and be very careful with what I say
in my request. They (HSC legal) are not happy with the change in
policy and don't know their motives behind the change. I hear that
some are being denied the application for the R-4. HSC said to
contact them if I have any problems. They have been very helpful.
Also told me not to say anything to our charter school about leaving
until our R-4 is in place. I have to meet with our ES tomorrow so I
will really have to bite my tongue!! Anyone out here in Calif. filed
an R-4 lately? Any advice you can give me? Thanks, Sara --- In
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, SandraDodd@a... wrote:
>
> In a message dated 1/21/03 9:33:39 AM, evelynsfarm@m... writes:
>
> << I have been reading, reading and reading. Sandra, your site is
great. >>
>
> Oooh! thanks!
>
> <<,I am leaning to declaring my freedom on that day and
> jump out of the California charter circus. >>
>
> Where are you in California?
> Have you been to one of the conferences in Sacramento? Are you
going this
> year? August 16 weekend.
>
> Sandra
>
> Sandra

messages.subject: SandraDodd website and all of you
messages.msgSnippet: I have been reading, reading and reading. Sandra, your site is great. You and some of the others here are inspiring to a new one like me. I have my monthly
messages.messageBody:
I have been reading, reading and reading. Sandra, your site is great.
You and some of the others here are inspiring to a new one like me.
I have my monthly meeting with our "ES" on Thursday and OH am I
dreading it! I am leaning to declaring my freedom on that day and
jump out of the California charter circus. Thanks to all. I am glad
to be a part of an encouraging and informative group. Sara
